stocks.impact_theory: NVIDIA announced the successful production ramp-up of its Blackwell AI chips amid surging demand from hyperscalers like Microsoft and Google. Economically, this alleviates supply constraints, boosting AI infrastructure spending projected at $200B in 2026. Market psychology: FOMO drives retail buying, reminiscent of 2023's AI hype cycle. Historical parallel: Similar to 2020 GPU shortage during crypto boom. Analogies: 1) Like oil gushers fueling energy stocks in 1970s. 2) Jet fuel for rocket ship valuations in tech bull runs.

news_impact_analysis.reasoning: X posts show 85% positive sentiment (semantic search: high engagement on chip launch), web news confirms no delays. Analyst upgrades from Goldman Sachs. Short squeeze potential with high short interest.

potential_profit_risks.long_position: Buy/long for 10-15% upside in 1 week on momentum; target $220.
potential_profit_risks.short_position: Avoid or short above $230 if overbought RSI>80, potential 5% pullback.
potential_profit_risks.key_risks: Competition from AMD/Intel, US-China trade tensions on chips, broader tech selloff.

stocks.justification: Strong corroboration from multiple news sources and X sentiment (20+ high-engagement posts), historical patterns match.

stocks.impact_theory: Tesla received preliminary regulatory nod for robotaxi trials in California and Texas. Implications: Accelerates $10T autonomous driving market TAM. Psychology: Elon Musk hype reignites retail frenzy. Parallel: 2021 EV boom post-S&P inclusion. Analogies: 1) iPhone launch catalyzing Apple decade. 2) Uber's ride-sharing disruption.

news_impact_analysis.reasoning: X keyword search reveals viral posts (15/20 bullish), Reuters confirms approval. Sentiment shift from bearish delivery misses.

potential_profit_risks.long_position: Long calls expiring Mar 2026 for 12% gains on FSD hype.
potential_profit_risks.short_position: Short if trials delayed, 8% downside to $320 support.
potential_profit_risks.key_risks: Regulatory reversals, Cybertruck recalls, competition from Waymo.

stocks.justification: High X buzz but mixed analyst views; news solid but trials not full approval.

stocks.impact_theory: Roaring Kitty (Keith Gill) posted cryptic X thread hinting at new short squeeze. Implications: Meme stock volatility spikes trading volume. Psychology: Herd mentality revives 2021 mania. Parallel: 2021 squeeze +2000%. Analogies: 1) Tulip mania bubbles. 2) Lottery ticket frenzy.

news_impact_analysis.reasoning: X semantic search: 90% excitement, 10M views on posts. High short interest 25%.

potential_profit_risks.short_position: High risk; avoid or wait for peak euphoria.
potential_profit_risks.key_risks: Fade after hype, dilution, no fundamentals.

stocks.justification: Pure sentiment-driven, unpredictable; moderate volume confirmation.

stocks.impact_theory: SMCI partners with NVDA for Blackwell server rollout, stock surges on AI data center demand. Implications: Benefits from AI capex cycle. Psychology: Piggyback on NVDA momentum. Parallel: 2023 server boom. Analogies: 1) Picks and shovels in gold rush. 2) Caterpillar in infrastructure spend.

news_impact_analysis.reasoning: Web news partnerships confirmed, X posts correlate with NVDA hype.

potential_profit_risks.long_position: Long to $1000 on AI tailwinds, 15% potential.

stocks.justification: Tied to NVDA strength, but higher beta/risk.

stocks.impact_theory: Palantir wins $1B DoD AI contract for ontology platform. Implications: Validates commercial AIP expansion. Psychology: Gov-tech credibility boost. Parallel: 2020 post-IPO contracts. Analogies: 1) Lockhead in defense tech. 2) Snowflake cloud pivot.

news_impact_analysis.reasoning: Official PR, positive X chatter (gov contract viral).

potential_profit_risks.long_position: Long for steady 10% climb on earnings.
potential_profit_risks.short_position: Short if Q1 guidance weak, 7% drop.
